definition: seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly
certainly/must/will/necessarily
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: They are working hard against the clock to translate the novel.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在分秒必争地赶紧翻译那本小说。

sentences.english: He was working against the clock to try to finish studying before the final exam.
sentences.chinese: 他分秒必争，试着在期末考前把书念完。

sentences.english: There's two levels of difficulty and you can compete against others or race against the clock.
sentences.chinese: 有两个层面的困难，你能与别人或分秒必争。

sentences.english: Yes, every minute counts, for the meeting is very important.
sentences.chinese: 是的，分秒必争，因为那场会议非常重要。

to race against time
time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
matter of life and death
pressing/urgent
all the time
to seize every minute (idiom)/to make the best use of one's time
race (running)/to race (running)
to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
lit. speed is a crucial asset in war (idiom)/fig. swift and resolute (in doing sth)
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine

definition: lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to brook no delay/to demand immediate action
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
